results.title: Self defence by plants
results.brief_description: A study of the various self-protective characteristics which are found among plants, including the early seed case, the bud scales and leaf hairs, and the different methods of protection used by leaves and flowers against damage by rain and animals.

results.title: Self-portrait. Parts 1-5
results.brief_description: An anthology of scenes from memorable National Film Board films produced during the years from 1939 to 1960. Text on the screen identifies the film and its makers before each excerpt is shown, and the commentator notes the significant characteristics of each film’s style and subject.

results.title: Self-motivated achiever
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Dr. McClelland discusses the special problems that management encounters with employees who have a strong need for achievement . The talk is based on his book ‘the Achieving Society

results.title: Self-help
results.brief_description: Villagers in Malaya, living in widely separated huts open to attack by terrorists, clear a new site and move their village to an area more easily protected by police and their newly formed Home Guard unit.

results.title: Selective breeding
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Ron Lea
results.brief_description:
Investigates the deliberate breeding of particular characteristics into different animals. Discusses the idea that many fashionable characteristics can lead to animals which are not functional. Also looks at the breeding of horses and chickens with breeders outlining some of the methods used to produce or maintain particular characterisitics.
Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Selections from the Christmas Oratorio by J.S. Bach
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: The Montreal Bach Choir under the direction of George Little has sung in many countries. This film presents the choir in one of its most distinguished performances with guest soloists Elizabeth Benson Guy, soprano; Maureen Forrester, contralto; Glenn Schnittke, tenor; Jan Simons, bass; James Ranti, trumpet; and Calvin Sieb, concertmaster.

results.title: Selections from a child's garden of verses
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, Wil Berg and Robert Louis Stevenson
results.brief_description: Wildberg, who made this film, reads excerpts from Robert Louis Stevenson’s collection including “I have a little shadow” and “The Swing”, while a boy experiences or watches others experience the emotions and sensations of the poems

results.title: Selection of Your Horse
results.brief_description: In this program Captain Mark Phillips enables you, the prospective purchaser to determine your requirements in a saddle horse and shows you how to look for a suitable animal. He explains in clear terms the individual attributes of a horse that are important to you to consider and pays particular attention to the following areas: (1) Conformation, (2) Soundness, (3) Temperament, (4) Performance under saddle, (5) Dangers and pitfalls and how to avoid them, (6) Veterinary report and how to evaluate it.

results.title: Seinfeld. Vol. 06
results.brief_description: Three episodes from “Seinfeld” screened during 1991. The tape includes a bonus 100th episode with excerpts from throughout the season. “The Heart attack”; Always the hypochondriac, George thinks he’s suffering a heart attack, only to discover he has tonsilitis. He tries everything to avoid the operation, including consulting a holistic healer. “The Deal”; A channel surfing night on the couch leads to Jerry and Elaine rekindling their relationship- only they have to set a few ground rules first. Jerry is troubled when he has to find an ‘appropriate’ present because of their new relationship. “The Library”; Jerry is contacted regarding an overdue library book dating back to 1971. There’s a flashback to Jerry and George in highschool, who have different accounts of the day in question. Produced by Larry Charles, directed by Joshua White. “100th episode”. Introduced by Jerry Seinfeld and featuring excerpts from the series funniest moments. Produced by Peter Mehlman and Susan Mamann Greenberg, directed by Andy Ackerman.

results.title: Seinfeld. Vol. 05
results.brief_description: Features 3 “Seinfeld” episodes screened between 1990-1997. “The Busboy”; George tries to make it up to a busboy he has fired while Elaine risks life and limb to get rid of a visiting boyfriend. “The Baby Shower”; Kramer cons Jerry into having an illegal cable link. The day they instal the cable Elaine is hosting a baby shower in Jerry’s apartment. One of the guests previously dated George and humilated him on a date. “The Hamptons”; Produced by Tom Gammill and Max Pross. Jerry, Elaine, Kramer, George and George’s new girlfriend spend an eventful weekend at the holiday house of friends with an “ugly” baby. Everyone except George sees his new girlfriend baking topless, Kramer stumbles across a catch of lobsters, and George is caught in an embarrassing situation due to “shrinkage”.
